                       java.util.HashMap p)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        evaluate Ax+b.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface VecFunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        x - VectorIntf
        p - HashMap must contain the following pairs:
        • <"A", double[][]> the matrix A, optional.
        • <"b", double[]> the vector b, optional.
        Returns:
        VectorIntf the vector y=Ax+b
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if A=b=null, or if A, b, and x dimensions don't match.

      • evalCoord

        public double evalCoord(VectorIntf x,
                        java.util.HashMap p,
                        int coord)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: VecFunctionIntf
        evaluate only one coordinate (component) of the vector function.
        Specified by:
        evalCoord in interface VecFunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        x - VectorIntf
        p - HashMap
        coord - int must be in the range {0,1...getNumCoords()-1}
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arg is null or not in the domain of the function, or if the coord is not in the range of the dimensions of the function.
